intro: Barkeria uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower barkeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Barkeria uniflora has small, compound leaves and produces a single, prominent flower per stem. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
